tit.e: Kiku no Kisewata (Chrysanthemum Covers, a custom of the Imperial Court in the Chrysanthemum Festival)
Kiku no Kisewata (Chrysanthemum Covers, a custom of the Imperial Court in the Chrysanthemum Festival)

sen.j: 菊の着綿（きくのきせわた）とは重陽の節句に行われる宮中の習慣。
sen.e: Chrysanthemum Covers are a custom of imperial court observed in Chrysanthemum Festival.
Kiku no Kisewata is a custom of the Imperial Court held in Chrysanthemum Festival.
Kiku no Kisewata is a custom of the Imperial Court held in Chrysanthemum Festival.
It is also a season word of Chrysanthemum.
It is also a season word of Choyo (one of the five seasonal festivals in the Edo period, which was taken place on September 9).
It is also a season word of Choyo (one of the five seasonal festivals in the Edo period, which was taken place on September 9).

sen.j: 平安時代の貴族の習慣である。
sen.e: It is a custom of nobility in Heian Era.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is a custom of nobility in Heian period.
It is a custom of nobility in Heian period.

sen.j: 重陽の日に菊の花に植物染料で染めた黄色の真綿を被せ、明くる早朝に朝露を含んだ綿を菊より外す。
sen.e: Chrysanthemum is covered with yellow floss silk, dyed with plant-dyes, on the Chrysanthemum Day and on next early morning, yellow floss silk that absorbed morning dew is taken off the chrysanthemum.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: On the Choyo day, the flower of chrysanthemum is covered with yellow floss silk, dyed with plant-dyes, and on the following early morning, yellow floss silk that absorbed morning dew is taken off the chrysanthemum.

On the Choyo day, the flower of chrysanthemum is covered with yellow floss silk, dyed with plant-dyes, and on the following early morning, yellow floss silk that absorbed morning dew is taken off the chrysanthemum.

sen.j: その綿で体を拭えば菊の薬効により無病であるという。
sen.e: It is said that wiping the body with the morning dew soaked floss silk will keep illness away by healing properties of chrysanthemum.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処菊の薬効：ここでは実際の薬の薬効ではなく、風習的（言い伝えのような）なものなので、effect of the medicineではなくhealing propertyと訳しました。
sen.e: It is said that wiping the body with the morning dew soaked floss silk would keep illness away by healing properties of chrysanthemum.
It is said that wiping the body with the morning dew soaked floss silk would keep illness away by healing properties of chrysanthemum.

sen.j: 中国の伝説に、上流に菊の花園がある滝の菊の花びらが漬かった水を飲んだ人が長寿を得たというものがある。
sen.e: There is a Chinese Legend that a person who drank water from a waterfall with soaked chrysanthemum, where there is a chrysanthemum garden at upstream, has gained a long life.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: There is a Chinese Legend that a person who drank water from a waterfall, of which there was a chrysanthemum garden at upstream where petals of chrysanthemum were soaked, had gained a long life.
There is a Chinese Legend that a person who drank water from a waterfall, of which there was a chrysanthemum garden at upstream where petals of chrysanthemum were soaked, had gained a long life.

sen.j: また能の「枕慈童」に中国の故事として菊の露を飲んで不老不死になった少年が登場する。
sen.e: Also a boy who became immortal by drinking chrysanthemum dew appears in "Makurajidou" (Jido and Pillow, Noh play) as a Chinese historical event.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Also a boy who became immortal by drinking chrysanthemum dew appears in 'Makurajido' (Jido and Pillow, Noh play) as a Chinese historical event.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションにしました。
sen.e: Also a boy who became immortal by drinking chrysanthemum dew appears in 'Makurajido' (Jido and Pillow, Noh play) as a Chinese historical event.

sen.j: 菊を服用するなどして薬効を得るのはもとは中国の習慣であったと思われる。
sen.e: Custom of taking chrysanthemum for its healing property is believed to originate in China.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Gaining the medicinal effect of chrysanthemum by taking it, and so on, is believed originally as a custom in China.
Gaining the medicinal effect of chrysanthemum by taking it, and so on, is believed originally as a custom in China.

sen.j: また、室町時代には菊酒という菊を浸した酒を飲むことも行われるようになった。
sen.e: Also people started drinking kikuzake (Japanese sake with chrysanthemum blooms) in Muromachi Era.
Also people started drinking kikuzake (Japanese sake liquor with chrysanthemum blooms) in Muromachi period.

sen.j: いずれも古くは京都・上方地域の一部に残った風習であったが、昨今ではみられなくなった。
sen.e: Long time ago those customs were remained in part of Kamigata region in Kyoto, but recently are not practiced.
In earlier times, those were the customs remained in part of Kamigata region in Kyoto, but not practiced recently.
